concept.title: Security
concept.shortdesc: The security framework establishes trust between members and authorizes cache operations from clients based on that trust. You establish trust by verifying credentials when one process connects to another.

conbody.p:
For example:
New members connect to the locator in a peer-to-peer topology.
Clients connect to cache servers.
A Diffie-Hellman key exchange encrypts sensitive credentials.
